title: Conftrotter
segmentation: Hi guys I'm Tom and I'm part of this wonderful group called The Leftovers.
The people you see here great people to work with and we made this wonderful thing called.
Contractor now where does this come from?

Well, about two years ago when I started my PhD, there was this guy who came up to me and he said, oh great, you're doing page D. You hope you like traveling because you will see the world and a PhD is essentially seeing the world in four years.
So when I told this to my colleagues at this got us thinking, no, what if we actually, you know, expand on this?
What if we actually enable you to see the world in four years?
Using your research while automatically also enriching your research?
So This is why we made come true.
Now I want to ask you something who here who is doing a pH D felt like this?
I'm going to guess 100%, you know.
It's all about motivation.
You know you need.
If you're doing a page, you're constantly trying to be creative.
You have to collaborate.
You have to publish.
I mean publish or perish.
You know you really have this pressure on your shoulders.
Well, if you need this motivation, well.
This could be it you could.
You could broaden your horizons while enriching your research.
I thought it was a really nice Logan thanks to our actually thanks to our supervisors as well.
John and Mary Belt now.
This thing is essentially what we want to do, right?
So when we started thinking about this, we saw.
Well, what's out there, what's out there that can help us?
And there's all these really cool things that they classify under research 2.0, which is stuff like wiki CFP.
You've got social networks like ResearchGate.
Stuff like that.
But we saw that all of these things are really UN personal.
And also there's no real link data feature there.
So this got us thinking, what if we combine this stuff?
And that's

The idea, so essentially the first step in our in our process would be, you know, we need to find your conference and events that are relevant for you guys for your yourself, and that's would be based on your research interests.

Preferably now we had these research interests because a couple of days ago you made this great profile and added all your interests and we also had some conference link data thanks to our team members.
Silver who set this up for his.
Research he had a data set that was crawled over wiki CFP and events.
Here an stored.
All this conference info as linked data which is really cool.
Also this was linked to geodata to Geonames, so we could query data and map it all out on this map.
Now if you stop there, this would be a very boring system.
So.
We also made it interesting by seeing who can you collaborate with to get to this conference.
You know?
How can you get there with better success rate?
So if you.
See a conference.
You automatically also get to suggestion the people that are also have this conference in their suggestions.
There is a direct mapping between them, you know.
And these are the ones that you can collaborate with and this can lead to very interesting combinations.
For example, if there is a conference on music and computing, then I'm a computer scientist an if someone of you was a music ologist, we could have a really nice collaboration there.
Out of our two research interests.
Now we went even further an we said, well, you could also find a lot of useful stuff.
You know we want this thing to become your one stop checklist for your conference and how to get there.
So you've got scientific aspects.
You can look at relevant publications for it.
You can see the conference rating, but you also have the non scientific stuff.
I mean it can be work all the time.
You can see about you know.
Where can I go sightseeing?
Is this an interesting location?
Maybe there are some concerts there at the same time.
I mean all of this stuff would be really cool, but I think it's better if I.
Just show you guys what this does.
So this is a screencast.
If you want to see a live demo, it totally works.
You can ask the provenance of this.
You can ask our supervisor.
We showed him.
You can also come to us afterwards.
Now this is what kind of filter does.
So if I log in under my profile.
You can see that my conferences are displayed on the map and I can, you know, look through them really quickly.
Now I found this really cool conference in Puket.
Really like to go there and if I click on it you can see who I can collaborate with.
And apparently Mohammed has the same research interests for me for this conference, so we could really collaborate together so I can click on Muhammad's.
I can see.
OK as you dare.
I don't know if you notice, we can.
I can also see weather.
This this conference is in a short time span or not an I can you know?
Browse to the information of the conference and see on events here.
You know what's it about?
There's a what's the call for papers, stuff like that.
So unfortunately, this is all historical data because we had to do it offline.
It's not really up to date.
Well, we didn't have four years into the future of data, so we assumed it was 2008.
So unfortunately, we can't collaborate on this.
But maybe we can find another one with the live system.
Now.
Let's take a look at what we have here.
What the added value.
Actually, as of this system.
So I talked about the scientific benefits and that's it.
You know?
Obviously you have very useful collaborations here, and you can go well.
You can identify the people you want to work with a sensory.
The whole point of doing a PhD.
Now you can also look at the submission of conditions.
What do I need for this?
This conference?
Do I have sufficient time for the deadline?
Um, do I have to write H page paper to get there?
Or maybe a poster paper?
And also look at relevant publications you know what did people send to this conference before?
Maybe look at the topic of the conference and see.
OK, let's do a quick state of the art here and eventually you want to know if there is this a good conferences.
This is some shady conference about just about anything you really don't want to go there because it won't have any value for you.
You could look at the impact factor of the conference, for example.
And stuff like that.
So this is essentially an infinite list of things you could do it right?
So this is all future work and more.
Now let's look at the fun side of it as well.
Well, the first point is, isn't that fun?
But it's also important you know not every lab has a lot of money.
Unfortunately, as you have noticed, there's five of us here, so we were pretty lucky, but not every lab is just as lucky, so the budget comes in as well.
We can start classifying conferences under well.
Is it far away?
Is it expensive conferences?
It medium is a cheap, so we could take that into account as well, but more fun stuff.
Location information we can like retrieve.
Interesting tourist attractions in the neighborhood.
Maybe car rental information so you can explore the area a bit well if you go further on that we can also look at accommodation.
Maybe there's a really good hotel near the conference venue and.
Maybe you can do some other stuff there as well.
You know Co located events, concerts, things like that.
Again infinite list, so we really look for for interesting stuff here.
So basically that's.
I would like to thank you will be taking grants and donations now and if you'd like to see the demo live and working, I suggest you come to us and we'll show you.
Thank you.
